comment._content: Streetview only goes to the gates. Ordnance Survey for the win!

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Talking about Gilbert & Sullivan.... Gilbert O'Sullivan was born Raymond Edward O'Sullivan on 1st December 1946 in Waterford in Ireland. He is still singing. www.gilbertosullivan.net

comment.author: 60765183@N08
comment._content:
The rugs at the front are interesting. 

The one on the right appears to have a Turkmen (Central Asia) design. The one on the left is more difficult to see but I'd guess that it's Persian.  Both look to have some age which means they might have been woven in the late19th century.

Oriental rugs of that period are quite rare in Ireland. I wonder how these examples ended up in Rockwell in the 1930s. It they're still in existence, they'd be quite interesting.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Niall's link to the OSI brought it back to me, the location is outside the village of New Inn a few miles south of the town of Cashel and on the Cashel side.  They won the Munster Schools Senior Cup this year beating St Munchins in the final so it was only that generation that were wusses!
